abstract: European leaders continue struggling to craft bolder solution to the region's financial crisis, despite clear signals from French and German officials, who face core differences over how to maximize the euro zone's financial rescue fund and how far the European Central Bank should intervene in the bond markets.
snippet: The main players, France and Germany, face sharp differences heading into an important weekend summit meeting in Brussels.
lead_paragraph: The main players, France and Germany, face sharp differences heading into an important weekend summit meeting in Brussels.

headline.main: Europeans Seek Bold Debt Deal, Despite Differences
headline.print_headline: Europeans Seek Bold Debt Deal, Despite French and German Differences
headline.seo: European Leaders Seek Bold Debt Deal, Despite Hurdles
